meta.title: WordPress Developer — optimization, fixes, improvements
meta.description: WordPress developer with 10+ years of experience: 500+ projects, 100+ performance optimizations, 300+ fixes and improvements. Fast, clean, with results.

hero.title: WordPress developer with 10+ years of experience: optimization, fixes, improvements
hero.subtitle: I make websites faster, more stable, and more convenient for business. No “plugins for everything” — I find the root cause, fix it, verify the result, and send a short report.

benefits.title: What you get
benefits.body: A clear plan, step-by-step execution, and a summary of “before / after”. If the task can’t be solved with a “quick fix”, I’ll tell you upfront.

performance.title: Performance optimization (Core Web Vitals)
performance.body: CLS/LCP/INP, critical CSS, JS, fonts, images, caching/server. I optimize in a way that improves speed without breaking layout or functionality.

fixes.title: Bug fixes and improvements in WordPress
fixes.body: Themes/plugins, forms, multilingual, WooCommerce, integrations. I quickly find the root cause and fix it without side effects.

maintenance.title: Technical support and stability
maintenance.body: Updates, backups, security, monitoring, urgent incidents. I keep the site running so it earns money instead of causing stress.

step1.title: 1) Diagnosis
step1.body: I review symptoms, logs, Lighthouse/PSI, plugins, theme, and critical requests. Then I compile a short list of root causes.

step2.title: 2) Plan & estimate
step2.body: I prioritize what brings the biggest impact with the lowest risk. We agree on scope, timing, and reporting format.

step3.title: 3) Implementation
step3.body: Step-by-step with checkpoints. If needed — staging/backup, targeted changes, minimal “magic”.

step4.title: 4) Verification & summary
step4.body: Re-testing, “before/after” measurements, and a list of what was done. I also suggest next steps if you want more gains.

proof.title: Proof: reviews and portfolio
proof.note: You can quickly assess my level from reviews and examples. If needed, I’ll send relevant cases for your specific task.

oneTime.title: One-off task
oneTime.body: For a specific fix/improvement/small audit. Best when you need something done “right now” and the scope is clear.

batch.title: Hour package
batch.body: When there are many different tasks: fixes, small improvements, consultations, optimizations. Saves time on approvals.

monthly.title: Maintenance
monthly.body: For sites that must run reliably: updates, backups, security, monitoring, and ongoing improvements.

contact.title: Contact me
contact.subtitle: Send a link to the website and 1–2 sentences about what bothers you (speed / bug / improvement). I’ll reply with an initial action plan.
